intro: Astragalus cuscutae var. pulcher, commonly known as the Indian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces pods that contain minute, rounded seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its historical use in traditional medicine.
